user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of ahc_echo:
```c
static enum MHD_Result
ahc_echo (void *cls,
          struct MHD_Connection *connection,
          const char *url,
          const char *method,
          const char *version,
          const char *upload_data, size_t *upload_data_size, void **req_cls)
{
  static int aptr;
  struct MHD_Response *response;
  enum MHD_Result ret;
  (void) cls;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) url;               /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) version;           /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) upload_data;       /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */
  (void) upload_data_size;  /* Unused. Silent compiler warning. */

  if (0 != strcmp (method, "GET"))
    return MHD_NO;              /* unexpected method */
  if (&aptr != *req_cls)
  {
    /* do never respond on first call */
    *req_cls = &aptr;
    return MHD_YES;
  }
  *req_cls = NULL;                  /* reset when done */
  response = MHD_create_response_from_callback (MHD_SIZE_UNKNOWN,
                                                80,
                                                &data_generator, NULL, NULL);
  ret = MHD_queue_response (connection, MHD_HTTP_OK, response);
  MHD_destroy_response (response);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No compiler language extensions were detected in the provided code. The constructs used are standard C: a normal function definition and prototype, a function-local static variable (static int aptr), enum type usage (enum MHD_Result), pointer and address operations (&aptr, *req_cls), standard casts to void to silence unused-parameter warnings, and calls to library functions/macros (MHD_create_response_from_callback, MHD_SIZE_UNKNOWN, MHD_queue_response). There are no GCC/Clang/MSVC-specific extensions such as __attribute__, __builtin_*, typeof, statement expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, inline assembly (asm), Microsoft-specific declspecs, or other documented compiler extensions. Library macros/identifiers that begin with MHD_ are API/library-specific but are not language/compiler extensions and therefore are not flagged here.
